column2: NORTH DAKOTA DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Which shape is a stop sign?
2. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column4: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 3. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
4. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

column2: 5. When approaching the scene of a crash, you should:
column8: if you are involved in the crash, do not drive away and help secure medical aid for the injured.

column2: 6. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
7. Which shape is a warning sign?
8. An inattentive driver:
column4: carries on an eye-contact conversation with a passenger while driving.
column6: gazes at objects off the roadway while driving.

column2: 9. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column6: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column8: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

column2: 10. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
11. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted
column6: All traffic must turn right at next intersection

column2: 12. This road sign means:
13. This road sign means:
column6: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column8: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 14. Work zone signs:
column4: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.
column6: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column8: mean that road conditions will improve soon.
column10: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.

column2: 15. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 16. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
17. ABS is the acronym for:
18. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when it is hard to see ahead.
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 19. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
20. This road sign means:
21. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column6: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column8: speed up to beat the train.

column2: 22. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 23. You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:
column6: wait for the owner to return.
column8: leave a note on the vehicle and report the accident with no delay.
column10: call your insurance company within 14 days.

column2: 24. Highway markings:
column4: are usually red and blue in color.
column8: are only found in school zones.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
